conclusion: System initially at equilibrium with atmospheric pressure P0, volume of gas in section C is Vc, volume of gas in section B is Vb
Apply mass m to piston, creating additional pressure ΔP, new pressure in system becomes P0 + mg/A
Volume of gas in section C changes to Vc' due to applied pressure
Assuming gas follows Boyle's Law (constant temperature), initial and final states of gas are related by P0 Vc = (P0 + ΔP) Vc'
Solving for Vc': Vc' = P0 Vc / (P0 + ΔP)
Change in volume ΔV in section C is ΔV = Vc - Vc'
Substitute Vc': ΔV = Vc - P0 Vc / (P0 + ΔP)
Simplify expression: ΔV = Vc (1 - P0 / (P0 + ΔP)) = Vc ΔP / (P0 + ΔP)
Volume change ΔV in section C is equal to volume of solid displaced
Volume of solid V_solid is ΔV
Final answer: Volume of solid is V_solid = Vc ΔP / (P0 + ΔP)
